com.stripe.android

Class CustomerSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stripe.android.CustomerSession

  • public class CustomerSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a logged-in session of a single Customer. See Creating ephemeral keys

    • Method Detail

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession(android.content.Context context,
                                       EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider,
                                       java.lang.String stripeAccountId,
                                       boolean shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey)
        Create a CustomerSession with the provided EphemeralKeyProvider.

        You must call PaymentConfiguration.init(Context, String) with your publishable key before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        ephemeralKeyProvider - An EphemeralKeyProvider used to retrieve CustomerEphemeralKey ephemeral keys
        stripeAccountId - An optional Stripe Connect account to associate with Customer-related Stripe API Requests. See Stripe.Stripe(Context, String, String).
        shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey - If true, will immediately fetch an ephemeral key using . Otherwise, will only fetch an ephemeral key when needed.

      • initCustomerSession

                                       EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider,
                                       java.lang.String stripeAccountId)
        See initCustomerSession(Context, EphemeralKeyProvider, String, boolean)

      • getInstance

        public static CustomerSession getInstance()
        Gets the singleton instance of CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        the singleton CustomerSession instance.

      • endCustomerSession

        public static void endCustomerSession()
        End the singleton instance of a CustomerSession. Calls to getInstance() will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls initCustomerSession(Context, EphemeralKeyProvider) again.

      • cancelCallbacks

        public static void cancelCallbacks()
        End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay. No need to call initCustomerSession(Context, EphemeralKeyProvider) again after this operation.

      • addProductUsageTokenIfValid

        public void addProductUsageTokenIfValid(java.lang.String token)

      • retrieveCurrentCustomer

        public void retrieveCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Retrieve the current Customer. If the cached value at mCustomer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer, either from the cache or from the server

      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.
        Parameters:
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer from the server

      • getCachedCustomer

        public Customer getCachedCustomer()
        Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.
        Returns:
        the current value of mCustomer, or null if the customer object is expired.

      • addCustomerSource

        public void addCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId,
                              java.lang.String sourceType,
                              CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
        Add the Source to the current customer.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be added
        listener - a CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the added Source.

      • deleteCustomerSource

        public void deleteCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId,
                                 CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
        Delete the Source from the current customer.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be deleted
        listener - a CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the added Source.

      • attachPaymentMethod

        public void attachPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethodId,
                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
        Attaches a PaymentMethod to a customer.
        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be attached
        listener - a CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the attached PaymentMethod.

      • detachPaymentMethod

        public void detachPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethodId,
                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
        Detaches a PaymentMethod from a customer.
        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be detached
        listener - a CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the detached PaymentMethod.

      • getPaymentMethods

        public void getPaymentMethods(PaymentMethod.Type paymentMethodType,
                              CustomerSession.PaymentMethodsRetrievalListener listener)
        Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a PaymentMethod.Type.
        Parameters:
        paymentMethodType - the PaymentMethod.Type to filter by
        listener - a CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with a list of PaymentMethod objects

      • setCustomerShippingInformation

        public void setCustomerShippingInformation(ShippingInformation shippingInformation)
        Set the shipping information on the current customer.
        Parameters:
        shippingInformation - the data to be set

                                     java.lang.String sourceType,
                                     CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
        Set the default Source of the current customer.
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be set
        listener - a CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the updated customer
